intro: Busbeckea lorantifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved busbeckia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with its foliage often appearing in dense clusters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
